object.name: Device.FAP.
object.description: This object is the container for all Femto related component objects, to prevent pollution of the so-called global namespace of the BBF with FAP specific objects.

object.name: Device.FAP.GPS.
object.description: This object contains the parameters relating to the GPS scan.

parameter.name: ScanOnBoot
parameter.description: Enables or disables GPS scans during the device start up.

parameter.name: ScanPeriodically
parameter.description: Enables or disables periodic GPS scans.

parameter.name: PeriodicInterval
parameter.description: When {{param|ScanPeriodically}} is {{true}}, this value indicates the interval in {{units}} which GPS scan is performed.

parameter.name: PeriodicTime
parameter.description:
An absolute time reference in UTC to determine when the CPE will initiate the periodic GPS scan. Each GPS scan MUST occur at (or as soon as possible after) this reference time plus or minus an integer multiple of the {{param|PeriodicInterval}}.
{{param}} is used only to set the "phase" of the GPS scan. The actual value of {{param}} can be arbitrarily far into the past or future.
For example, if {{param|PeriodicInterval}} is 86400 (a day) and if {{param}} is set to UTC midnight on some day (in the past, present, or future) then periodic GPS scans will occur every day at UTC midnight. These MUST begin on the very next midnight, even if {{param}} refers to a day in the future.
The Unknown Time value defined in {{bibref|TR-106|Section 3.2}} indicates that no particular time reference is specified. That is, the CPE MAY locally choose the time reference, and needs only to adhere to the specified PeriodicInformInterval.
If absolute time is not available to the CPE, its periodic GPS scan behavior MUST be the same as if {{param}} parameter was set to the Unknown Time value.

parameter.name: ContinuousGPS
parameter.description: Whether or not the device SHOULD maintain a continuous GPS lock (e.g. as a frequency stability source).

parameter.name: ScanTimeout
parameter.description: Specifies the time-out value in {{units}} since the scan started after which the scan will time out. A timed out scan is to be reported as {{enum|Error_TIMEOUT|ScanStatus}} with {{param|ErrorDetails}} indicating "Timed out"

parameter.name: ScanStatus
parameter.description: Indicates the current status of this scan.

enumeration.description: The scan has not been executed and there are no valid scan results available

parameter.name: ErrorDetails
parameter.description: Provides more detail when the {{param|ScanStatus}} is either {{enum|Error|ScanStatus}} or {{enum|Error_TIMEOUT|ScanStatus}}.

parameter.name: LastScanTime
parameter.description: The date and time when the last GPS scan completed.

parameter.name: LastSuccessfulScanTime
LockedLatitude
parameter.description:
This parameter specifies the latitude of the device's position in degrees, multiplied by 1 million. The positive value signifies the direction, north of the equator. The negative value signifies the direction, south of the equator.
Range is from: 90d00.00' South (-90,000,000) to 90d00.00' North (90,000,000).
Example: A latitude of 13d19.43' N would be represented as 13,323,833, derived as (13*1,000,000)+((19.43*1,000,000)/60). Latitude of 50d00.00' S would be represented as value -50,000,000.
{{template|FAP-GPS-RESET}}
If a scan has never succeeded before, the value 0 is reported.

parameter.name: LockedLongitude
parameter.description:
This parameter specifies the longitude of the device's position in degrees, multiplied by 1 million. The positive value signifies the direction, east of the prime meridian. The negative value signifies the direction, west of the prime meridian.
Range is from: 180d00.00' West (-180,000,000) to 180d00.00' East (180,000,000).
Example: A longitude of 13d19.43' E would be represented as 13,323,833, derived as (13*1,000,000)+((19.43*1,000,000)/60). A longitude of 50d00.00' W would be represented as value -50,000,000.
{{template|FAP-GPS-RESET}}
If a scan has never succeeded before, the value 0 is reported.

parameter.name: NumberOfSatellites

object.name: Device.FAP.GPS.ContinuousGPSStatus.
object.description:
When {{param|#.ContinuousGPS}} is {{true}}, the parameters in this object contain the GPS status as it is continuously monitored.
When {{param|#.ContinuousGPS}} is {{false}}, the parameters in this object are not being updated and their values are not accurate.

parameter.name: CurrentFix
parameter.description: The value is {{true}} if the location fix is currently valid (i.e. GPS receiver is currently tracking satellite signals), otherwise it is {{false}}. After a reboot the value is {{false}} until the GPS receivers has a valid current position.

parameter.name: GotFix
parameter.description:
The value is {{true}} if {{param|CurrentFix}} has transitioned to {{true}} at least once since {{param|#.ContinuousGPS}} was enabled, otherwise it is {{false}}. After a reboot the value is {{false}} until {{param|CurrentFix}} has transitioned to {{true}} again.
The GPS coordinates ({{param|Latitude}}, {{param|Longitude}}, and {{param|Elevation}}) are not valid until {{param}} has a value of {{true}}.

parameter.name: TimingGood
Latitude
parameter.description:
This parameter represents the most recent latitude reading for the device's position in degrees, multiplied by 1 million. The positive value signifies the direction, north of the equator. The negative value signifies the direction, south of the equator.
Range is from: 90 deg 00.00' South (-90,000,000) to 90 deg 00.00' North (90,000,000).
Example: A latitude of 13 deg 19.43' N would be represented as 13,323,833, derived as (13*1,000,000)+((19.43*1,000,000)/60). Latitude of 50 deg 00.00' S would be represented as value -50,000,000.
{{param}} is not valid until {{param|GotFix}} is {{true}}.
If the parameter has never been set before, the value 0 is reported. The value SHOULD be maintained over a reboot.

parameter.name: Longitude
parameter.description:
This parameter represents the most recent longitude reading for the device's position in degrees, multiplied by 1 million. The positive value signifies the direction, east of the prime meridian. The negative value signifies the direction, west of the prime meridian.
Range is from: 180d00.00' West (-180,000,000) to 180d00.00' East (180,000,000).
Example: A longitude of 13d19.43' E would be represented as 13,323,833, derived as (13*1,000,000)+((19.43*1,000,000)/60). A longitude of 50d00.00' W would be represented as value -50,000,000.
{{param}} is not valid until {{param|GotFix}} is {{true}}.
If the parameter has never been set before, the value 0 is reported. The value SHOULD be maintained over a reboot.

parameter.name: Elevation
parameter.description:
This parameter represents the most recent elevation reading for the device's position in {{units}}, relative to the WGS84 ellipsoid. The positive value signifies the direction, above sea level. The negative value signifies the direction, below sea level.
Range is from: 5,000.000 meters below sea level (-5,000,000) to 25,000.000 meters above sea level (25,000,000).
{{param}} is not valid until {{param|GotFix}} is {{true}}.
If the parameter has never been set before, the value 0 is reported. The value SHOULD be maintained over a reboot.

parameter.name: LastFixTime
parameter.description:
Represents the date and time when the last GPS Fix was acquired.
The Unknown Time value defined in {{bibref|TR-106|Section 3.2}} is used when {{param|GotFix}} is {{false}}. This applies too after a reboot of the device until a valid location is determined and {{param|GotFix}} transsitions to {{true}}.

parameter.name: LastFixDuration
parameter.description: Number of {{units}} of continuous GPS fix time. After a reboot this value is reset to 0.

parameter.name: FirstFixTimeout
parameter.description:
Number of {{units}} to wait for first GPS fix before declaring a GPS fault.
A value of -1 means that there is no timeout and no fault logging.

parameter.name: SatellitesTracked
parameter.description: The number of satellites the receiver is tracking.

parameter.name: SatelliteTrackingInterval
parameter.description: The interval in {{units}} at which the GPS tracking information gets reported.

parameter.name: ReceiverStatus
parameter.description: The output of the GPS receiver's status.

parameter.name: LocationType
parameter.description: Indicates whether the {{param|Latitude}}, {{param|Longitude}}, and {{param|Elevation}} values are determined via a GPS Fix (where the value of this parameter would be {{enum|Real}}) or via some other means (where the value of this parameter would be {{enum|Reference}}).

parameter.name: LockTimeOutDuration
parameter.description: The timer duration, in {{units}}, for which the device waits for GPS to acquire lock.

object.name: Device.FAP.GPS.AGPSServerConfig.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables the {{object}} entry.

parameter.name: ServerURL
parameter.description: A-GPS server host name or IP address.

parameter.name: ServerPort
parameter.description: The port to use when communicating to the A-GPS Server.

parameter.name: Username
parameter.description: Username to be used by the device to authenticate with the A-GPS server. This string is set to {{empty}} if no authentication is used.

parameter.name: Password
parameter.description: Password to be used by the device to authenticate with the A-GPS server. This string is set to {{empty}} if no authentication is used.

parameter.name: ReferenceLatitude
parameter.description:
This parameter specifies the reference latitude for an A-GPS request position in degrees, multiplied by 1 million. The positive value signifies the direction, north of the equator. The negative value signifies the direction, south of the equator.
Range is from: 90d00.00' South (-90,000,000) to 90d00.00' North (90,000,000).
Example: A latitude of 13d19.43' N would be represented as 13,323,833, derived as (13*1,000,000)+((19.43*1,000,000)/60). Latitude of 50d00.00' S would be represented as value -50,000,000.

parameter.name: ReferenceLongitude
parameter.description:
This parameter specifies the reference longitude for an A-GPS request position in degrees, multiplied by 1 million. The positive value signifies the direction, east of the prime meridian. The negative value signifies the direction, west of the prime meridian.
Range is from: 180d00.00' West (-180,000,000) to 180d00.00' East (180,000,000).
Example: A longitude of 13d19.43' E would be represented as 13,323,833, derived as (13*1,000,000)+((19.43*1,000,000)/60). A longitude of 50d00'00'' W would be represented as value -50,000,000.

parameter.name: ServerInUse
parameter.description:
The value is {{true}} if the device has successfully contacted and received A-GPS info from the A-GPS server, otherwise the value is {{false}}.
After a reboot the value is {{false}} until the server could be contacted again.

object.name: Device.FAP.PerfMgmt.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to Performance Management in a Femto-related environment.

parameter.name: ConfigNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: {{numentries}}

object.name: Device.FAP.PerfMgmt.Config.{i}.
object.description: This object contains parameters relating to File Management configuration for uploading of Performance Files to a designated File Server. Each table entry can be referenced by zero or more radio-specific objects contained in the FAPService instances. The periodic upload will upload data for all of the radio-specific objects that reference it.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables or disables this entry. If this entry is disabled then its periodic uploads are not performed.

parameter.name: Alias
parameter.description: {{datatype|expand}}

parameter.name: URL
parameter.description:
{{datatype}} specifying the destination file location. HTTP and HTTPS transports MUST be supported. Other transports MAY be supported.
This argument specifies only the destination file location, and does not indicate in any way the name or location of the local file to be uploaded.

parameter.name: Username
parameter.description: Username to be used by the device to authenticate with the file server. This string is set to {{empty}} if no authentication is used.

parameter.name: Password
parameter.description: Password to be used by the device to authenticate with the file server. This string is set to {{empty}} if no authentication is used.

parameter.name: PeriodicUploadInterval
parameter.description: The duration in {{units}} of the interval for which the device MUST create a Performance File and attempt to upload the file to {{param|URL}} if {{param|Enable}} is {{true}}.

parameter.name: PeriodicUploadTime
parameter.description:
An absolute time reference in UTC to determine when the device will initiate the periodic file upload. Each file upload MUST occur at this reference time plus or minus an integer multiple of the {{param|PeriodicUploadInterval}}.
{{param}} is used only to set the "phase" of the periodic uploads. The actual value of {{param}} can be arbitrarily far into the past or future.
For example, if {{param|PeriodicUploadInterval}} is 86400 (a day) and if {{param}} is set to UTC midnight on some day (in the past, present, or future) then periodic file uploads will occur every day at UTC midnight. These MUST begin on the very next midnight, even if {{param}} refers to a day in the future.
The Unknown Time value as defined in {{bibref|TR-106|Section 3.2}} indicates that no particular time reference is specified. That is, the device MAY locally choose the time reference, and is REQUIRED only to adhere to the specified {{param|PeriodicUploadInterval}}.
If absolute time is not available to the device, its periodic file upload behavior MUST be the same as if the {{param}} parameter was set to the Unknown Time value.

object.name: Device.FAP.ApplicationPlatform.
object.description:
This object defines the data model for the following Femtozone APIs.
* Femto Awareness
* SMS
* MMS
* Terminal Location
Femto Awareness, SMS, MMS, and Terminal Location APIs are defined in the Release 1 API Specifications of the Service SIG in the Femto Forum (non public document).
{{bibref|TR-262|appendix I}} provides the "Theory of Operation" for the usage of this object.

parameter.name: Version
parameter.description: Version of Femto Application Platform running on this device

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enable or disable the Femto ApplicationPlatform

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: Current state of the Femto Application Platform.

enumeration.description: The Femto Application Platform is not available
The Femto Application Platform is available
The FemtoApplicationPlatform is in the process of being reset and will transition to the {{enum|Disabled}} state when the reset operation is completed
The FemtoApplicationPlatform is being initialized and will transition to the {{enum|Enabled}} state once the initialization is completed

parameter.name: MaxNumberOfApplications
parameter.description: Determines how many Femtozone Applications can be supported by the Femto Application Platform simultaneously.

parameter.name: CurrentNumberofApplications
parameter.description: Specifies how many Femtozone Applications are currently communicating with the Femto Application Platform.

object.name: Device.FAP.ApplicationPlatform.Capabilities.
object.description: This object contains parameters related to the capabilities of the Femtozone Application Platform and the Femtozone APIs.

parameter.name: PresenceApplicationSupport
parameter.description: Specifies whether the Femto Application Platform supports Presence-Based Femtozone Applications

parameter.name: FemtoAwarenessAPISupport
parameter.description: Specifies whether the Femto Awareness API is supported on this device.

parameter.name: SMSAPISupport
parameter.description: Specifies whether the SMS API is supported on this device.

parameter.name: SubscribeToNotificationsOfSMSSentToApplicationSupport
parameter.description: Specifies whether the SubscribeToNotificationsOfSMSSentToApplication functionality is supported by the FAP SMS API.

parameter.name: QuerySMSDeliveryStatusSupport
parameter.description: Specifies whether the QuerySMSDeliveryStatus functionality is supported by the FAP SMS API.

parameter.name: MMSAPISupport
parameter.description: Specifies whether the MMS API is supported on this device.

parameter.name: QueryMMSDeliveryStatusSupport
parameter.description: Specifies whether the QueryMMSDeliveryStatus functionality is supported by the FAP MMS API.

parameter.name: SubscribeToNotificationsOfMMSSentToApplicationSupport
parameter.description: Specifies whether the SubscribeToNotificationsOfMMSSentToApplication functionality is supported by the FAP MMS API.

parameter.name: TerminalLocationAPISupport
parameter.description: Specifies whether the Terminal Location API is supported on this device.

parameter.name: AuthenticationMethodsSupported
parameter.description: Specifies the supported methods that 3rd Party Applications can use to authenticate with the Femto Application Platform at initialization.

parameter.name: AccessLevelsSupported
parameter.description: Specifies the supported access levels that 3rd Party Applications can request when authenticating with the Femto Application Platform at initialization. This access level is with respect to resources within the Femto Application Platform only (not to be confused with Access Mode parameter in .FAPService.{i}.AccessMgmt).

parameter.name: SendSMSTargetAddressType
parameter.description: Specifies the supported types of addresses SMSs can be sent to.

parameter.name: SendMMSTargetAddressType
parameter.description: Specifies the supported types of addresses MMSs can be sent to.

object.name: Device.FAP.ApplicationPlatform.Control.
object.description: This object contains parameters related to the operation of the Femtozone APIs.

parameter.name: AuthenticationMethod
parameter.description:
Specifies how 3rd Party Applications have to authenticate against Femto APIs in order to use it. {{reference}}
'''''Note:''''' The credentials are not part of the data model and have to be supplied externally.

parameter.name: TunnelInst
parameter.description:
This is the reference to the IPsec tunnel instance to be used by the Application Platform traffic.
The {{param}} MUST point to a tunnel instance defined in the data model.
If the referenced object is deleted, the parameter value MUST be set to an empty string.

object.name: Device.FAP.ApplicationPlatform.Control.FemtoAwareness.
object.description: This object contains parameters related to the Femto Awareness API.

parameter.name: APIEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable FemtoAwareness API exposure on FAP

parameter.name: QueueEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable Request queueing for the API

parameter.name: Queueing
parameter.description: Determines how FAP handles simultaneous requests from different Applications to Femto Awareness API.

parameter.name: MaxAPIUsersNumber
parameter.description: Determines the Max Number of different Applications that can send Requests to Femto Awareness API.

parameter.name: FemtozoneID
parameter.description: Specifies Identifier of the Femtozone.

parameter.name: NotificationsUserIdentifierMSISDN
parameter.description: Specifies whether the Mobile Station International Subscriber Directory Number (MSISDN) has to be used as UserIdentifier in Femto Awareness Notifications. A value of {{true}} means that the MSISDN is send as user identifier, a value of {{false}} means that an anonymous reference is used.

parameter.name: SubscribeToNotificationsResponseCallbackData
parameter.description: Specifies whether the OPTIONAL Argument "Callback Data" has to be used in Responses to Requests to "Subscribe To Femto Awareness Notifications".

parameter.name: QueryFemtocellResponseTimezone
parameter.description: Specifies whether the OPTIONAL Argument "Timezone" has to be used in Responses to Requests to "Query Femtocell Status".

object.name: Device.FAP.ApplicationPlatform.Control.SMS.
object.description: This object contains parameters related to the SMS API.

parameter.name: APIEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable SMS API exposure on FAP

parameter.name: QueueEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable Request queueing for the API

parameter.name: Queueing
parameter.description: Determines how FAP handles simultaneous requests from different Applications to SMS API.

parameter.name: MaxAPIUsersNumber
parameter.description: Determines the Max Number of different Applications that can send Requests to SMS API.

parameter.name: MinSendSMSTimeInterval
parameter.description: Determines the Minimum Time Interval in {{units}} between two consecutive Send SMS Requests by the same Application.

parameter.name: EnableQuerySMSDeliveryStatus
parameter.description: Enable or disable "QuerySMSDeliveryStatus" Operation on SMS API. When disabled, QuerySMSDeliveryStatus Requests to SMS API are ignored.

parameter.name: EnableSubscribeToNotificationsOfMessageSentToApplication
parameter.description: Enable or disable "SubscribeToNotificationsOfMessageSentToApplication" Operation on SMS API. When disabled, SubscribeTo NotificationsOfMessageSentToApplication Requests to SMS API are ignored.

object.name: Device.FAP.ApplicationPlatform.Control.MMS.
object.description: This object contains parameters related to the MMS API.

parameter.name: APIEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable MMS API exposure on FAP

parameter.name: QueueEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable Request queueing for the API

parameter.name: Queueing
parameter.description: Determines how FAP handles simultaneous requests from different Applications to MMS API.

parameter.name: MaxAPIUsersNumber
parameter.description: Determines the Max Number of different Applications that can send Requests to MMS API.

parameter.name: MinSendMMSTimeInterval
parameter.description: Determines the Minimum Time Interval in {{units}} between two consecutive Send MMS Requests by the same Application.

parameter.name: EnableQueryMMSDeliveryStatus
parameter.description: Enable or disable "QuerySMSDeliveryStatus" Operation on MMS API. When disabled, QuerySMSDeliveryStatus Requests to MMS API are ignored.

parameter.name: EnableSubscribeToNotificationsOfMessageSentToApplication
parameter.description: Enable or disable "SubscribeTo NotificationsOfMessageSentToApplication" Operation on MMS API. When disabled, SubscribeTo NotificationsOfMessageSentToApplication Requests to MMS API are ignored.

object.name: Device.FAP.ApplicationPlatform.Control.TerminalLocation.
object.description: This object contains parameters related to the TerminalLocation API.

parameter.name: APIEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable TerminalLocation API exposure on FAP

parameter.name: QueueEnable
parameter.description: Enable or disable Request queueing for the API

parameter.name: Queueing
parameter.description: Determines how FAP handles simultaneous requests from different Applications to TerminalLocation API.

parameter.name: MaxAPIUsersNumber
parameter.description: Determines the Max Number of different Applications that can send Requests to TerminalLocation API.

parameter.name: QueryMobileLocationResponseAddress
parameter.description: Specifies Terminal Address Format to be used in QueryMobileLocation Responses.

parameter.name: QueryMobileLocationResponseLongitudeLatitude
parameter.description: Include or exclude FAP Longitude and Latitude arguments in Responses to QueryMobileLocation Requests.

parameter.name: QueryMobileLocationResponseAltitude
parameter.description: Include or exclude FAP Altitude argument in Responses to QueryMobileLocation Requests .

parameter.name: QueryMobileLocationResponseTimestamp
parameter.description: Specifies Response Timestamp in {{units}}.

object.name: Device.FAP.ApplicationPlatform.Monitoring.
object.description: This object contains parameters related to the monitoring of the Femtozone Application Platform and the Femtozone APIs.

parameter.name: Enable
parameter.description: Enables and disables this entry.

parameter.name: MonitoringInterval
parameter.description: Specifies the interval in {{units}} used to collect the monitoring measurements.

parameter.name: AuthenticationRequestsReceived
parameter.description: Specifies the total number of authentication requests received by the Femto Application Platform. The counter will be reset whenever the device reboots or the {{param|Enable}} parameter is set to {{true}}.

parameter.name: AuthenticationRequestsRejected
parameter.description: Specifies the number of authentication requests received by the Femto Application Platform that were rejected. The counter will be reset whenever the device reboots or the {{param|Enable}} parameter is set to {{true}}.

object.name: Device.FAP.ApplicationPlatform.Monitoring.FemtoAwareness.
object.description: This object contains parameters related to the Monitoring of the FemtoAwareness API.

parameter.name: APIAvailable
parameter.description: Specifies whether the FemtoAwareness API is currently available on this device (the API could be disabled or could have exhausted its resources)

parameter.name: APIUsers
parameter.description: Specifies the current number of Applications using the Femto Awareness API.

parameter.name: QueueState
parameter.description: Specifies the state of the Femto Awareness API Queue.

parameter.name: QueueNum
parameter.description: Specifies the current number of requests waiting in the Femto Awareness API Queue.

parameter.name: QueueReceived
parameter.description: Specifies the number of requests in the Femto Awareness API Queue that have been received. The counter will be reset whenever the device reboots or the {{param|#.Enable}} parameter is set to {{true}}.

parameter.name: QueueDiscarded
parameter.description: Specifies the number of requests in the Femto Awareness API Queue that have been discarded. The counter will be reset whenever the device reboots or the {{param|#.Enable}} parameter is set to {{true}}.

object.name: Device.FAP.ApplicationPlatform.Monitoring.SMS.
object.description: This object contains parameters related to the Monitoring of the SMS API.

parameter.name: APIAvailable
parameter.description: Specifies whether the SMS API is currently available on this device (the API could be disabled or could have exhausted its resources)..

parameter.name: APIUsers
parameter.description: Specifies the current number of Applications using the SMS API.

parameter.name: QueueState
parameter.description: Specifies the state of the SMS API Queue.

parameter.name: QueueNum
parameter.description: Specifies the current number of requests waiting in the SMS API Queue.

parameter.name: QueueReceived
parameter.description: Specifies the number of requests in the SMS API Queue that have been received. The counter will be reset whenever the device reboots or the {{param|#.Enable}} parameter is set to {{true}}.

parameter.name: QueueDiscarded
parameter.description: Specifies the number of requests in the SMS API Queue that have been discarded. The counter will be reset whenever the device reboots or the {{param|#.Enable}} parameter is set to {{true}}.

object.name: Device.FAP.ApplicationPlatform.Monitoring.MMS.
object.description: This object contains parameters related to the Monitoring of the MMS API.

parameter.name: APIAvailable
parameter.description: Specifies whether the MMS API is currently available on this device (the API could be disabled or could have exhausted its resources)..

parameter.name: APIUsers
parameter.description: Specifies the current number of Applications using the MMS API.

parameter.name: QueueState
parameter.description: Specifies the state of the MMS API Queue.

parameter.name: QueueNum
parameter.description: Specifies the current number of requests waiting in the MMS API Queue.

parameter.name: QueueReceived
parameter.description: Specifies the number of requests in the MMS API Queue that have been received. The counter will be reset whenever the device reboots or the {{param|#.Enable}} parameter is set to {{true}}.

parameter.name: QueueDiscarded
parameter.description: Specifies the number of requests in the MMS API Queue that have been discarded. The counter will be reset whenever the device reboots or the {{param|#.Enable}} parameter is set to {{true}}.

object.name: Device.FAP.ApplicationPlatform.Monitoring.TerminalLocation.
object.description: This object contains parameters related to the Monitoring of the TerminalLocation API.

parameter.name: APIAvailable
parameter.description: Specifies whether the TerminalLocation API is currently available on this device (the API could be disabled or could have exhausted its resources)..

parameter.name: APIUsers
parameter.description: Specifies the current number of Applications using the Terminal Location API.

parameter.name: QueueState
parameter.description: Specifies the state of the Terminal Location API Queue.

parameter.name: QueueNum
parameter.description: Specifies the current number of requests waiting in the Terminal Location API Queue.

parameter.name: QueueReceived
parameter.description: Specifies the number of requests in the Terminal Location API Queue that have been received. The counter will be reset whenever the device reboots or the {{param|#.Enable}} parameter is set to {{true}}.

parameter.name: QueueDiscarded
parameter.description: Specifies the number of requests in the Terminal Location API Queue that have been discarded. The counter will be reset whenever the device reboots or the {{param|#.Enable}} parameter is set to {{true}}.
